poem:
"Reel to Reality: A Cinematic Reverie"

Forty years past, in silver screen's cloister,
Indiana Jones, Spielberg's own coin,
Brandished whip and hat, a cinematic soothsayer,
A twenty-minute saga began, no time to conjoin.

From the glitz of '35 Shanghai, harking back,
To Himalayan rapids in boisterous overflow,
A slice of life, crafted for the cinephile's knack,
Ever resonant, in the theater's timeless glow.
